Suitable_Structures: Recharge wells, Percolation tanks, Recharge trenches
Feasibility_Notes: Highly suitable for recharge due to high permeability and storage capacity

Suitable_Structures: Recharge shafts, Injection wells (preferably in fractured zones)
Feasibility_Notes: Moderately suitable; recharge effective only through fractures/joints

Suitable_Structures: Recharge shafts, Check dams, Injection wells (fractured zones)
Feasibility_Notes: Low storage, depends on fractures; recharge possible with shafts

Suitable_Structures: Recharge shafts, Check dams, Injection wells
Feasibility_Notes: Similar to granite; limited recharge through fractures

Suitable_Structures: Recharge trenches, Spreading basins, Recharge wells
Feasibility_Notes: Moderate to good recharge capacity; widely used for RTRWH

Suitable_Structures: Recharge shafts, Injection wells (karst areas highly permeable)
Feasibility_Notes: Highly permeable in karst zones; excellent recharge potential

Suitable_Structures: Recharge shafts (limited), Check dams, Small pits
Feasibility_Notes: Generally low permeability; recharge possible in weathered zones
Recharge through weathered/fractured zones; moderate capacity

Suitable_Structures: Recharge pits, Small trenches, Percolation tanks
Feasibility_Notes: Moderate suitability; recharge effective in weathered zones
Low to moderate suitability; recharge in fractured rock
Recharge feasible with deep artificial structures

Suitable_Structures: Recharge shafts, Check dams, Injection wells
Feasibility_Notes: Hard rock; recharge limited to weathered/fractured zones
